sentence.idiomatic: That walkman doesn't look so great.
Mr. Li looks very happy.
How does Ms. Wang look? She looks very healthy.
Does this walkman comes with earphones? Yes.
That television does not come with a remote control.
I took my friend out to eat.
Does this price include shipping costs? It does.
The staff in our department include Ms. Li, Ms. Wang, Mr. Zhang and Mr. Wan.
It will take us an hour to get there, not including the time stuck in traffic.
The price of this walkman is not reasonable.
They are not giving enough money.
Mr. Wang's price is too high.
That walkman is a little bit expensive.
The quality of cheap televisions is not reliable.
This price is too expensive. Can you make it a bit cheaper?
Is there a discount right now for television buyers? There is.
What is the discount on this walkman? Ten percent.
Ever since it was first repaired, this computer has had quality problems.
This price is too expensive. Can you give me a discount?
This brand of computer has never been discounted before.
What is the discount on this television? Sixty percent.
If you pay in cash, we can give you a discount.
This is the car Mr. Wang bought with a credit card.
Can we use a check to buy this book? I'm sorry. We don't take checks.
This work must be completed today.
I've got to leave right now or else I will be late.
Our staff don't need to speak French, but they must speak English.
What did Mr. Li give to Ms. Wang? A book.
Mr. Zhang drove his wife to work.
We deliver merchandise right to the door.
This walkman looks good. Does it come with earphones?
The earphones are included and the price is reasonable. It's only US$200.
That seems a bit expensive to me. Is there any discount?
If you pay cash I can give you a 10 percent discount.
Okay, but you must give me the batteries for free.
